Data Processing¶

Utils¶

randomize(x, y)¶

Randomizes the order of data samples and their corresponding labels

Parameters

  • x – data

  • y – data labels

Returns

Tuple of (shuffled_x, shuffled_y) maintaining coherence of elements labels

get_next_batch(x, y, start, end)¶

Get next batch from x and y using start and end

Parameters

  • x – data

  • y – data labels

  • start – starting index of the batch to be returned

  • end – end index of the batch to be returned (not including)

Returns

tuple (x, y) of the selected batch

transform_to_real(x_complex)¶
Parameters

x_complex – Complex-valued matrix of size mxn

Returns

real-valued matrix of size mx(2*n) unwrapping the real and imag part of the complex-valued input matrix

separate_into_train_and_test(x, y, ratio=0.8)¶

Separates data x with corresponding labels y into train and test set.

Parameters

  • x – data

  • y – labels of data x

  • ratio – value between 0 and 1. 1 meaning all the data x will be the training set and 0 meaning all data x will be the test set.

Returns

tuple (x_train, y_train, x_test, y_test) of the training and test set both data and labels.

Save and load dataset¶

save_dataset(array_name, x_train, y_train, x_test, y_test)¶

Saves in a single .npz file the test and training set with corresponding labels

Parameters

  • array_name – Name of the array to be saved into data/ folder.

  • x_train –

  • y_train –

  • x_test –

  • y_test –

Returns

None

load_dataset(array_name)¶

Gets all x_train, y_train, x_test, y_test from a previously saved .npz file with save_dataset function.

Parameters

array_name – name of the file saved in ‘../data’ with .npz termination

Returns

tuple (x_train, y_train, x_test, y_test)
